intro: Gurania tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed gurania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having a distinct tricuspidate shape. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
